ace.en: A playing card with a single spot on it, ranked as the highest card in its suit in most card games.

actor.en: A person whose profession is acting on the stage, in movies, or on television.

almond.en: The oval nutlike seed (kernel) of the almond tree, growing in a woody shell.

alphabet.en: A set of letters or symbols in a fixed order, used to represent the basic sounds of a language.

amount.en: A quantity of something, typically the total of a thing or things in number, size, value, or extent.

arrow.en: A shaft sharpened at the front and with feathers or vanes at the back, shot from a bow as a weapon or for sport.

article.en: A piece of writing included with others in a newspaper, magazine, or other publication.

badger.en: A heavily built omnivorous nocturnal mammal of the weasel family, typically having a grey and black coat.

barber.en: A person who cuts men's hair and shaves or trims beards as an occupation.

basic.en: Forming an essential foundation or starting point; fundamental.

battle.en: A sustained fight between large, organized armed forces.

beginner.en: A person just starting to learn a skill or take part in an activity.

borrow.en: Take and use (something that belongs to someone else) with the intention of returning it.

bother.en: Take the trouble to do something.

cactus.en: A succulent plant with a thick, fleshy stem that typically bears spines, lacks leaves, and is frequently native to arid regions.

cartoon.en: A motion picture using animation techniques to photograph a sequence of drawings rather than real people or objects.

center.en: The middle point of a circle or sphere, equidistant from every point on the circumference or surface.

checkers.en: A board game for two players, each beginning with twelve pieces of one color that are placed on the board.

chimney.en: A vertical channel or pipe that conducts smoke and combustion gases up from a fire or furnace.

claim.en: State or assert that something is the case, typically without providing evidence or proof.

clerk.en: A person employed in an office or bank to keep records and accounts and to undertake other routine administrative duties.

click.en: A short, sharp sound as of a switch being operated or of two hard objects coming smartly into contact.

cliff.en: A steep rock face, especially at the edge of the sea.

clue.en: A piece of evidence or information used in the detection of a crime or solving of a mystery.

cocoon.en: A silky case spun by the larvae of many insects for protection in the pupal stage.

control.en: The power to influence or direct people's behavior or the course of events.

corner.en: A place or angle where two or more sides or edges meet.

cue.en: A thing said or done that serves as a signal to an actor or other performer to enter or to begin their speech or performance.

daydream.en: A series of pleasant thoughts that distract one's attention from the present.

drill.en: A hand tool, power tool, or machine with a rotating cutting tip or reciprocating hammer or chisel, used for making holes.

dust.en: Fine powder made from waste material or earth.

enemy.en: A person who is actively opposed or hostile to someone or something.

equal.en: Being the same in quantity, size, degree, or value.

erase.en: Rub out or remove (writing or marks).

example.en: A thing characteristic of its kind or illustrating a general rule.

field.en: An area of open land, especially one planted with crops or pasture, typically bounded by hedges or fences.

firefly.en: A soft-bodied beetle related to the glowworm, the winged male and flightless female of which both have luminescent organs.

fireworks.en: A device containing gunpowder and other combustible chemicals that causes a spectacular explosion when ignited.

firm.en: A business concern, especially one involving a partnership of two or more people.

flash.en: Shine in a bright but brief, sudden, or intermittent way.

flight.en: The action or process of flying through the air.

fresh.en: Recently made or obtained; not canned, frozen, or otherwise preserved.

giant.en: An imaginary or mythical being of human form but superhuman size.

grand.en: Magnificent and imposing in appearance, size, or style.

harbor.en: A place on the coast where vessels may find shelter, especially one protected from rough water by piers, jetties, and other artificial structures.

haunt.en: (of a ghost) manifest itself at (a place) regularly.

history.en: The study of past events, particularly in human affairs.

hungry.en: Feeling or displaying the need for food.

iron.en: A strong, hard magnetic silver-grey metal, much used as a material for construction and manufacturing.

island.en: A piece of land surrounded by water.

jellyfish.en: A free-swimming marine coelenterate with a jellylike bell- or saucer-shaped body that is typically transparent.

knight.en: (in the Middle Ages) a man who served his sovereign or lord as a mounted soldier in armor.

ladybird.en: A small beetle with a domed back, typically red or yellow with black spots.

lighthouse.en: A tower or other structure containing a beacon light to warn or guide ships at sea.

lonely.en: Sad because one has no friends or company.

maple.en: A tree or shrub with lobed leaves, winged fruits, and hard wood.

meter.en: The fundamental unit of length in the metric system, equal to 100 centimeters or approximately 39.37 inches.

middle.en: At an equal distance from the extremities of something; central.

mole.en: A small burrowing mammal with dark velvety fur, a long muzzle, and very small eyes.

narrow.en: (of something that is considerably longer than it is wide) of small width.

offer.en: Present or proffer (something) for (someone) to accept or reject as so desired.

onion.en: An edible bulb with a pungent taste and smell, composed of several concentric layers.

period.en: A length or portion of time.

plain.en: Not decorated or elaborate; simple or ordinary in character.

pretend.en: Speak and act so as to make it appear that something is the case when in fact it is not.

pride.en: A feeling or deep pleasure or satisfaction derived from one's own achievements.

recess.en: A period of time when the proceedings of a parliament, committee, court of law, or other official body are temporarily suspended.

record.en: A thing constituting a piece of evidence about the past, especially an account of an act or occurrence kept in writing or some other permanent form.

result.en: A consequence, effect, or outcome of something.

season.en: Each of the four divisions of the year (spring, summer, autumn, and winter).

settle.en: Resolve or reach an agreement about (an argument or problem).

share.en: A part or portion of a larger amount which is divided among a number of people, or to which a number of people contribute.

speech.en: The expression of or the ability to express thoughts and feelings by articulate sounds.

steak.en: High-quality beef taken from the hindquarters of the animal, typically cut into thick slices that are cooked by broiling or frying.

steel.en: A hard, strong, grey or bluish-grey alloy of iron with carbon and usually other elements.

Stone Age.en: A prehistoric period when weapons and tools were made of stone or of organic materials such as bone, wood, or horn.

strawberry.en: A sweet soft red fruit with a seed-studded surface.

success.en: The accomplishment of an aim or purpose.

sundown.en: The time in the evening when the sun disappears or daylight fades.

sunlit.en: Illuminated by direct light from the sun.

sunrise.en: The time in the morning when the sun appears or full daylight arrives.

supper.en: An evening meal, typically a light or informal one.

telephone.en: A system for transmitting voices over a distance using wire or radio, by converting acoustic vibrations to electrical signals.

thread.en: A long, thin strand of cotton, nylon, or other fibers used in sewing or weaving.

toilet.en: A fixed receptacle into which a person may urinate or defecate, typically consisting of a large bowl with a flushing mechanism.

total.en: Comprising the whole number or amount.

value.en: The importance, worth, or usefulness of something.

vote.en: A formal indication of a choice between two or more candidates or courses of action, expressed typically through a ballot or a show of hands.

wasp.en: A social winged insect which has a narrow waist and a sting and is typically yellow with black stripes.

wildcat.en: A small cat native to Europe, Africa, and Western Asia.

willow.en: A tree or shrub of temperate climates that typically has narrow leaves, bears catkins, and grows near water.

yourself.en: Used to refer to the person being addressed as the object of a verb or preposition when they are also the subject of the clause.

youth.en: The period between childhood and adult age.
